Module roborally
Package client.view

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
client.view.Controller
client.view.LoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Updatable
public class LoginController
extends Controller
implements Updatable
This class controls the loginView.fxml view, it takes the name and the chosen robot, sends it to client and switches to the game view
Author:
sarah,

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private static class  LoginController.Figure
    This private class is used to store the imageView of the figure and if it's taken or not.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private javafx.collections.ObservableList<LoginController.Figure> figures
    It stores the imageViews of the different robots, so that name and id from the chosen robot can be recognized.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label infoLabel
    A label to check if everything works.
    private javafx.scene.control.ListView<LoginController.Figure> listView
    The listView for choosing one robot, it stores different ImageViews.
    private com.jfoenix.controls.JFXTextField textUserName
    The player writes his username in this TextField.

    Fields inherited from class client.view.Controller

    cardFormat, robotNames, viewClient, viewManager

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    LoginController()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void createRobotList()
    This method creates a list with the robots and additional it adds imageViews for each robot to another list.
    private void fxButtonClicked()
    This method gets called by clicking on the 'Login' button, it checks if the username is valid and if a robot is selected and then it sends a PlayerValues protocol message and switches to the gameStage.
    void initialize()
    By initializing the view the listView gets filled with the imageViews of the robots and it makes sure that only one item of the listView can get clicked.
    void removePlayer​(Player player)
    This method is called when a player leaves the game.
    void requestFocus()
    This method sets the focus on the textinput label to aim for usability
    void setFigureTaken​(int playerID, int id)
    This method makes a figure ineligible if it has already been taken by the added player.
    void update​(JSONMessage message)
    This message gets errors related to login and displays them for a hort amount of timer in the infoLabel.

    Methods inherited from class client.view.Controller

    displayingTime, extractCardType, generateImageView, getProgrammingImageView, getRegisterPosition, getWasFormerRegister, setProgrammingImageView, setRegisterPosition, setWasFormerRegister

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • figures

      private final javafx.collections.ObservableList<LoginController.Figure> figures
      It stores the imageViews of the different robots, so that name and id from the chosen robot can be recognized.

    • textUserName

      private com.jfoenix.controls.JFXTextField textUserName
      The player writes his username in this TextField.

      private javafx.scene.control.Label infoLabel
      A label to check if everything works.

  • Constructor Details

    • LoginController

      public LoginController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      By initializing the view the listView gets filled with the imageViews of the robots and it makes sure that only one item of the listView can get clicked. And that the awarded figures cannot be picked.

    • requestFocus

      public void requestFocus()
      This method sets the focus on the textinput label to aim for usability

    • createRobotList

      private void createRobotList()
      This method creates a list with the robots and additional it adds imageViews for each robot to another list.

    • fxButtonClicked

      private void fxButtonClicked()
      This method gets called by clicking on the 'Login' button, it checks if the username is valid and if a robot is selected and then it sends a PlayerValues protocol message and switches to the gameStage.

    • setFigureTaken

      public void setFigureTaken​(int playerID, int id)
      This method makes a figure ineligible if it has already been taken by the added player.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the id of the player which gets added
      id - the id of the figure the player chose

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(Player player)
      This method is called when a player leaves the game. His figure is then set to re-selectable.
      Parameters:
      player - who has been removed

    • update

      public void update​(JSONMessage message)
      This message gets errors related to login and displays them for a hort amount of timer in the infoLabel.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Updatable
      Parameters:
      message - which is to be handled specifically in the LoginController
